text: Gillian Sally Bidgood (born 13 April 1948, Corbridge, d. 18 March 2018, Hammersmith) was a British botanist and plant collector noted for her study of the flora of Ethiopia, Zambia, and Tanzania, particularly Bignoniaceae. Bidgood worked at the Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew from 1973–2008, and over the course of her career took part in gathering over 13,000 specimens of African plants, describing at least two dozen species. == References == Category:1948 births Category:2018 deaths Category:20th-century botanists Category:20th- century British botanists Category:20th-century British women scientists Category:British women botanists Category:People from Corbridge
title: Sally Bidgood
